intro: Moschosma dimidiatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pale green to yellowish leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Moschosma dimidiatum is adapted to withstand drought and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
